drug.name: Detomidine
drug.description: Detomidine is an Î±2-adrenergic agonist that is used as a horse sedative. Normally, it is administered in the salt form, detomidine hydrochloride. This drug is prescribed by veterinarians and is marketed as _Dormosedan_. Currently, it is only approved by the FDA for use in horses but has been studied for use in other large animals.
drug.indication: Used as a large animal sedative, primarily in horses.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as o-xylenes. These are aromatic compounds that contain a o-xylene moiety, which is a monocyclic benzene carrying exactly two methyl groups at the 1- and 2-positions.
